intro: Echium pseudoviolaceum, commonly known as the slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium pseudoviolaceum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
